original_data.Title: Corporate Sustainability. Understanding and Seizing the Strategic Opportunity
original_data.Short Intro: The achievement of a balanced economic, social and environmental development - as expressed in the UN Agenda 2030 for Sustainable Development - is recognized as one of the major challenges humanity is facing today. What is less clear is whether and how organizations can generate business opportunities and value for their stakeholders while tackling such challenges.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

What is less clear is whether and how organizations can generate business opportunities and value for their stakeholders while tackling such challenges.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Understand the challenges of sustainable development and how organizations can create business opportunities while addressing them. Learn to generate value for stakeholders through sustainable practices.
unified_data.price: Free to Audit, Paid Certificate Available

original_data.Title: Visual Elements of User Interface Design
original_data.Short Intro: This design-centric course examines the broad question of what an interface is and what role a designer plays in creating a user interface. Learning how to design and articulate meaning using color, type, and imagery is essential to making interfaces function clearly and seamlessly. Through a series of lectures and visual exercises, you will focus on the many individual elements and components that make up the skillset of an interface designer. By the end of this course, you will be able to describe the key formal elements of clear, consistent, and intuitive UI design, and apply your learned skills to the design of a static screen-based interface.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish
original_data.Skills: User Interface Design (UI Design),User Experience (UX),Graphic Design,

unified_data.title: Visual Elements of User Interface Design
unified_data.description: This design-centric course examines the broad question of what an interface is and what role a designer plays in creating a user interface. Learning how to design and articulate meaning using color, type, and imagery is essential to making interfaces function clearly and seamlessly. Through a series of lectures and visual exercises, you will focus on the many individual elements and components that make up the skillset of an interface designer. By the end of this course, you will be able to describe the key formal elements of clear, consistent, and intuitive UI design, and apply your learned skills to the design of a static screen-based interface.
unified_data.prerequisites: Basic computer skills and a general interest in design. No prior design experience is required.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: By the end of the course, you will be able to describe the key elements of UI design and apply your knowledge to create a static screen-based interface. You'll learn to use color, type, and imagery effectively.

original_data.Title: Improving Communication Skills
original_data.Short Intro: Learn how to communicate more effectively at work and achieve your goals. Taught by award-winning Wharton professor and best-selling author Maurice Schweitzer, Improving Communications Skills is an essential course designed to give you both the tools you need to improve your communication skills, and the most successful strategies for using them to your advantage. You'll learn how to discover if someone is lying (and how to react if they are), how to develop trust, the best method of communication for negotiation, and how to apologize. You'll also learn when to cooperate and when to compete, how to create persuasive messages, ask thoughtful questions, engage in active listening, and choose the right medium (face-to-face conversation, video conference, phone call, or email) for your messages. By the end of the course, you'll be able to understand what others want, respond strategically to their wants and needs, craft convincing and clear messages, and develop the critical communication skills you need to get ahead in business and in life.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Chinese (Traditional), Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Chinese (Simplified), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: Improving Communication Skills
unified_data.description: Learn how to communicate more effectively at work and achieve your goals. Taught by award-winning Wharton professor and best-selling author Maurice Schweitzer, Improving Communications Skills is an essential course designed to give you both the tools you need to improve your communication skills, and the most successful strategies for using them to your advantage. You'll learn how to discover if someone is lying (and how to react if they are), how to develop trust, the best method of communication for negotiation, and how to apologize. You'll also learn when to cooperate and when to compete, how to create persuasive messages, ask thoughtful questions, engage in active listening, and choose the right medium (face-to-face conversation, video conference, phone call, or email) for your messages. By the end of the course, you'll be able to understand what others want, respond strategically to their wants and needs, craft convincing and clear messages, and develop the critical communication skills you need to get ahead in business and in life.
unified_data.prerequisites: None. Basic reading and comprehension skills are recommended.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Understand and apply effective communication strategies. Learn to identify deception, build trust, negotiate successfully, and craft persuasive messages. Improve active listening and choose the appropriate communication medium.
unified_data.price: Free to Audit, Paid Certificate Available

original_data.Title: Essentials of Global Health
original_data.Short Intro: Essentials of Global Health is a comprehensive introduction to global health. It is meant to introduce you to this topic in well-structured, clear and easy to understand ways. Much of the course will focus on five questions: What do people get sick, disabled and die from; Why do they suffer from these conditions? Which people are most affected? Why should we care about such concerns? What can be done to address key health issues, hopefully at least cost, as fast as possible, and in sustainable ways?  The course will be global in coverage but with a focus on low- and middle-income countries, the health of the poor, and health disparities. Particular attention will be paid throughout the course to health systems issues, the linkages between health and development, and health matters related to global interdependence. The course will cover key concepts and frameworks but be practical in orientation.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

The course will be global in coverage but with a focus on low- and middle-income countries, the health of the poor, and health disparities. Particular attention will be paid throughout the course to health systems issues, the linkages between health and development, and health matters related to global interdependence. The course will cover key concepts and frameworks but be practical in orientation.
unified_data.prerequisites: None. A basic understanding of health concepts is helpful but not required.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Understand key global health issues, health systems, and the impact of health disparities. Learn about the links between health and development, and explore solutions to address health challenges.

original_data.Title: Healthcare Data Models
original_data.Short Intro: Career prospects are bright for those qualified to work in healthcare data analytics. Perhaps you work in data analytics, but are considering a move into healthcare where your work can improve people’s quality of life. If so, this course gives you a glimpse into why this work matters, what you’d be doing in this role, and what takes place on the Path to Value where data is gathered from patients at the point of care, moves into data warehouses to be prepared for analysis, then moves along the data pipeline to be transformed into valuable insights that can save lives, reduce costs, to improve healthcare and make it more accessible and affordable. Perhaps you work in healthcare but are considering a transition into a new role. If so, this course will help you see if this career path is one you want to pursue. You’ll get an overview of common data models and their uses. You’ll learn how various systems integrate data, how to ensure clear communication, measure and improve data quality. Data analytics in healthcare serves doctors, clinicians, patients, care providers, and those who carry out the business of improving health outcomes. This course of study will give you a clear picture of data analysis in today’s fast-changing healthcare field and the opportunities it holds for you.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: French, Portuguese (European), Russian, English, Spanish

prerequisites: Basic understanding of data analytics concepts
learning_outcomes: Understand common healthcare data models and their applications.
Learn how systems integrate healthcare data.
Measure and improve data quality for effective analysis and clear communication in healthcare.

original_data.Title: Entrepreneurship 4: Financing and Profitability
original_data.Short Intro: Start-ups can benefit from a wide variety of financing options on the path to profitability, but how do you know which one to choose? This course explores different financing models, including bootstrapping, organic growth, debt and risk capital, and also provides a clear overview of equity financing including the key types of investors: angels, venture capital, and crowdfunding. You’ll learn about terms, and term sheets, exit modes and what exit strategy might be best for you. By the end of this course, you’ll have an understanding of what success looks like and how it can be financed. You’ll also be ready for the capstone project, in which you will get feedback on your own pitch deck, and may even be selected to pitch to investors from venture capital firms.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: Entrepreneurship 4: Financing and Profitability
unified_data.description: Start-ups can benefit from a wide variety of financing options on the path to profitability, but how do you know which one to choose? You’ll learn about terms, and term sheets, exit modes and what exit strategy might be best for you. By the end of this course, you’ll have an understanding of what success looks like and how it can be financed. You’ll also be ready for the capstone project, in which you will get feedback on your own pitch deck, and may even be selected to pitch to investors from venture capital firms.
unified_data.prerequisites: Basic understanding of business concepts and some familiarity with entrepreneurial ventures is recommended.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Understand various financing models like bootstrapping, venture capital, and crowdfunding. Learn about term sheets, exit strategies, and how to finance a startup for profitability, including preparing a pitch deck.

original_data.Title: Data Science in Real Life
original_data.Short Intro: Have you ever had the perfect data science experience? The data pull went perfectly. There were no merging errors or missing data. Hypotheses were clearly defined prior to analyses. Randomization was performed for the treatment of interest. The analytic plan was outlined prior to analysis and followed exactly. The conclusions were clear and actionable decisions were obvious. Has that every happened to you? Of course not. Data analysis in real life is messy. How does one manage a team facing real data analyses? In this one-week course, we contrast the ideal with what happens in real life. By contrasting the ideal, you will learn key concepts that will help you manage real life analyses.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

The conclusions were clear and actionable decisions were obvious. Has that every happened to you? Of course not. Data analysis in real life is messy. How does one manage a team facing real data analyses? In this one-week course, we contrast the ideal with what happens in real life. By contrasting the ideal, you will learn key concepts that will help you manage real life analyses.
unified_data.prerequisites: Basic understanding of data analysis concepts and some familiarity with statistical principles would be helpful.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Learn how to manage data analysis teams and navigate the complexities of real-world data projects, contrasting ideal scenarios with practical challenges for effective decision-making.

original_data.Title: Speaking to inform:  Discussing complex ideas with clear explanations and dynamic slides
original_data.Short Intro: In the professional realm, most speeches and presentations we give are informative in scope. A scientist needs to explain her recent research findings. A financial officer needs to report on quarterly earnings to his company’s board. A technology professional needs to educate a consumer about a new product. Any time you need to convey ideas or demonstrate a process, you’re dealing with informative speaking.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

original_data.Title: High-Impact Business Writing
original_data.Short Intro: Effective writing is a powerful tool in the business environment. Learn how to articulate your thoughts in a clear and concise manner that will allow your ideas to be better understood by your readers. Improve your business writing skill by learning to select and use appropriate formats for your audience, use the correct medium and adjust your writing style accordingly, as well as identify your objective and communicate it clearly. You'll also learn to spot, correct and avoid the most common writing pitfalls, and gain valuable experience analyzing, writing and revising a wide spectrum of business documents. From a simple email to a complete report, learn how to put good business writing to work for you.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: English

unified_data.learning_outcomes: Upon completion, you'll be able to write clear, concise business documents. You will learn to select appropriate formats, adjust your writing style, avoid common pitfalls, and effectively communicate your objectives.

original_data.Title: Positioning: What you need for a successful Marketing Strategy
original_data.Short Intro: Positioning is the heart of any Marketing Strategy, the core that you must get right. It does not matter whether you start with a clearly defined target group or with a differential value proposition: you will need end up with a clear segment or segments upon which we build our Marketing Plan.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.prerequisites: Basic understanding of marketing principles is recommended.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Upon completion, you'll understand the importance of positioning in marketing strategy. You'll learn to identify target segments and develop value propositions for effective marketing plans and successful campaigns.

original_data.Title: Developing a Leadership Framework
original_data.Short Intro: This course offers seasoned and up-and-coming leaders a clear, concise overview of the challenges of organizational leadership and practical strategies for improving as leaders. The lessons are structured around essential leadership responsibilities, including defining leadership, understanding what it is not, and understanding how to construct a leadership framework utilizing the elements of the 4D Leadership Development Framework.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: English
original_data.Skills: Understand the difference between leadership and management,Determine your leadership style,Define leadership,Assist in leading your organization to change management,Develop your leadership philosophy,

original_data.Short Intro: In this, the third Content Strategy course, participants will learn actionable ways to grow internal and external audiences.  They will deepen their understanding about those target individuals and will use a host of known and emerging tools and social networks to meaningfully reach them. As its name makes clear, this course will expand your content's impact and reach.

original_data.Title: Music Business Foundations
original_data.Short Intro: This course has been developed to provide students with the latest instruction on the best way for creators, consumers, and facilitators to navigate the resurgence of one of the world’s most exciting industries: the music business. Three things are clear about today’s music industry: The consumption of music is expanding at the greatest rate in history and from the most portals ever imagined, the cost of producing music is decreasing, and the number of artists creating and seeking to expose their work and develop careers through the Internet has increased dramatically. Whether you’re a music creator, consumer, or facilitator of this process, you’ll want to understand the history, underpinnings, and basics of the music business. Course author John Kellogg—administrator, educator, entertainment lawyer, performer, and radio and television personality—offers students the opportunity to learn the fundamental principles of the developing new music business, for now and into the future.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: English

unified_data.title: Music Business Foundations

Whether you’re a music creator, consumer, or facilitator of this process, you’ll want to understand the history, underpinnings, and basics of the music business. Course author John Kellogg—administrator, educator, entertainment lawyer, performer, and radio and television personality—offers students the opportunity to learn the fundamental principles of the developing new music business, for now and into the future.
unified_data.prerequisites: None. Basic understanding of music and the internet is helpful.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Students will understand the history, fundamentals, and current state of the music business. They will learn about revenue streams, copyright, contracts, and navigating the industry for creators, consumers, and facilitators.
unified_data.price: Free to audit. Paid certificate available.

original_data.Title: Decentralized Finance (DeFi) Opportunities and Risks
original_data.Short Intro: DeFi and the Future of Finance is a set of four courses that focus on decentralized finance. The final course is called DeFi Opportunities and Risks. It is essential that you complete the first three courses: I. DeFi Infrastructure; II. DeFi Primitives; and III. DeFi Deep Dive before beginning the fourth course. The course starts with the premise that an analysis of any new technology must clearly gauge the risks and challenges. Given that DeFi is only a few years old there are plenty of risks. The course begins with the most obvious risk: smart contract risk. Smart contracts are foundational for DeFi. The code of these contracts is public - opening a clear attack vector for hackers. That is, in traditional finance, hackers need to break into a system to get access to the code and data. In DeFi, everything is open source.There are many other risks studied including: Governance risk; Oracle risk; Scaling risk; Decentralized Exchange or DEX risk; Custodial risk; Environmental risk; and Regulatory risk.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: English
original_data.Skills: Understanding smart contract risk,Different approaches to custody,Ethereum 2.0 approaches to scaling,Mechanics and risks of decentralized exchange,Assessing regulatory risk,

unified_data.title: Decentralized Finance (DeFi) Opportunities and Risks

It is essential that you complete the first three courses: I. DeFi Infrastructure; II. DeFi Primitives; and III. DeFi Deep Dive before beginning the fourth course. The course starts with the premise that an analysis of any new technology must clearly gauge the risks and challenges. Given that DeFi is only a few years old there are plenty of risks. The course begins with the most obvious risk: smart contract risk. Smart contracts are foundational for DeFi. The code of these contracts is public - opening a clear attack vector for hackers. That is, in traditional finance, hackers need to break into a system to get access to the code and data. In DeFi, everything is open source.There are many other risks studied including: Governance risk; Oracle risk; Scaling risk; Decentralized Exchange or DEX risk; Custodial risk; Environmental risk; and Regulatory risk.
skills: Mechanics and risks of decentralized exchange
unified_data.prerequisites: Completion of the first three courses in the 'DeFi and the Future of Finance' specialization: DeFi Infrastructure, DeFi Primitives, and DeFi Deep Dive. Basic understanding of finance and blockchain concepts is recommended.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: This course focuses on identifying and analyzing risks associated with Decentralized Finance (DeFi), including smart contract risk, governance risk, oracle risk, and regulatory risk. It will equip you with an understanding of these challenges.
unified_data.price: Free to Audit. Paid Certificate Available.

original_data.Title: Professional Selling: Step 3 - Become a High-Performer
original_data.Short Intro: Foundational Skills and Knowledge Required of High Performing Salespeople. This course takes the mystery out of sales call preparation, execution, and follow up. Learners will gain a clear understanding of the sales process and the fundamental skills required to build lasting, long-term, trusting relationships with customers. Participants in Course Three will gain skills in planning a sales call from beginning to end while also seeking out opportunities to connect with the prospect. Important to successfully engaging with the prospect is being able to present and quantify the product as a solution to the prospect's problems. Successful salespeople need to be able to manage objections, build trust, and gain commitment as well as follow up with their prospect and turn them into a buyer.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: English
original_data.Skills: List methods for gaining committment from a prospect,Prepare a detailed sales call plan,Prepare for and address prospect concerns,Present and quantify solutions to a prospect,Explain the process and benefits of following up with a proscpect after a sales call,

original_data.Title: Business Intelligence and Competitive Analysis
original_data.Short Intro: By the end of 2019, it is clear that American Airlines (AAL), the world’s largest airline group and a SP500 company, is in trouble. With the growth rate of its stock price ranked at the bottom of all major US airlines and going in the opposite direction from the SP500 index, AAL needs to find out what is going on, and how to turn the company and its stock price around.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: English

unified_data.title: Business Intelligence and Competitive Analysis
unified_data.description: By the end of 2019, it is clear that American Airlines (AAL), the world’s largest airline group and a SP500 company, is in trouble. With the growth rate of its stock price ranked at the bottom of all major US airlines and going in the opposite direction from the SP500 index, AAL needs to find out what is going on, and how to turn the company and its stock price around.
unified_data.prerequisites: Basic understanding of business concepts and familiarity with Microsoft Excel.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: This course will enable you to analyze competitive landscapes, identify business problems, and develop strategies for turning around struggling businesses using business intelligence and data analysis.

original_data.Title: Music Business Foundations
original_data.Short Intro: This course has been developed to provide students with the latest instruction on the best way for creators, consumers, and facilitators to navigate the resurgence of one of the world’s most exciting industries: the music business. Three things are clear about today’s music industry: The consumption of music is expanding at the greatest rate in history and from the most portals ever imagined, the cost of producing music is decreasing, and the number of artists creating and seeking to expose their work and develop careers through the Internet has increased dramatically. Whether you’re a music creator, consumer, or facilitator of this process, you’ll want to understand the history, underpinnings, and basics of the music business. Course author John Kellogg—administrator, educator, entertainment lawyer, performer, and radio and television personality—offers students the opportunity to learn the fundamental principles of the developing new music business, for now and into the future.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: English

unified_data.title: Music Business Foundations
unified_data.description: This course has been developed to provide students with the latest instruction on the best way for creators, consumers, and facilitators to navigate the resurgence of one of the world’s most exciting industries: the music business. Whether you’re a music creator, consumer, or facilitator of this process, you’ll want to understand the history, underpinnings, and basics of the music business. Course author John Kellogg—administrator, educator, entertainment lawyer, performer, and radio and television personality—offers students the opportunity to learn the fundamental principles of the developing new music business, for now and into the future.
unified_data.prerequisites: None. Basic understanding of music and interest in the music business is recommended.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Students will learn the fundamentals of the music business, including its history, core principles, and how it's evolving. They will gain insights into navigating the industry as creators, consumers, or facilitators.

original_data.Title: Modeling Risk and Realities
original_data.Short Intro: Useful quantitative models help you to make informed decisions both in situations in which the factors affecting your decision are clear, as well as in situations in which some important factors are not clear at all. In this course, you can learn how to create quantitative models to reflect complex realities, and how to include in your model elements of risk and uncertainty. You’ll also learn the methods for creating predictive models for identifying optimal choices; and how those choices change in response to changes in the model’s assumptions. You’ll also learn the basics of the measurement and management of risk. By the end of this course, you’ll be able to build your own models with your own data, so that you can begin making data-informed decisions. You’ll also be prepared for the next course in the Specialization.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: French, Portuguese (European), Portuguese (Brazilian), Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: Modeling Risk and Realities
unified_data.description: Useful quantitative models help you to make informed decisions both in situations in which the factors affecting your decision are clear, as well as in situations in which some important factors are not clear at all. In this course, you can learn how to create quantitative models to reflect complex realities, and how to include in your model elements of risk and uncertainty. You’ll also learn the methods for creating predictive models for identifying optimal choices; and how those choices change in response to changes in the model’s assumptions. You’ll also learn the basics of the measurement and management of risk. By the end of this course, you’ll be able to build your own models with your own data, so that you can begin making data-informed decisions. You’ll also be prepared for the next course in the Specialization.
unified_data.prerequisites: Basic understanding of Microsoft Excel and foundational math skills (algebra). No prior experience in risk modeling is required.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: By the end of this course, you will learn how to create quantitative models, incorporate risk and uncertainty, build predictive models, and manage risk using your own data to make informed decisions.
unified_data.price: Free to Audit. Paid Certificate available.

original_data.Title: Programming Fundamentals
original_data.Short Intro: Programming is an increasingly important skill, whether you aspire to a career in software development, or in other fields. This course is the first in the specialization Introduction to Programming in C, but its lessons extend to any language you might want to learn. This is because programming is fundamentally about figuring out how to solve a class of problems and writing the algorithm, a clear set of steps to solve any problem in its class. This course will introduce you to a powerful problem-solving process—the Seven Steps—which you can use to solve any programming problem. In this course, you will learn how to develop an algorithm, then progress to reading code and understanding how programming concepts relate to algorithms.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: Programming Fundamentals
unified_data.description: Programming is an increasingly important skill, whether you aspire to a career in software development, or in other fields. This course is the first in the specialization Introduction to Programming in C, but its lessons extend to any language you might want to learn. This is because programming is fundamentally about figuring out how to solve a class of problems and writing the algorithm, a clear set of steps to solve any problem in its class. This course will introduce you to a powerful problem-solving process—the Seven Steps—which you can use to solve any programming problem. In this course, you will learn how to develop an algorithm, then progress to reading code and understanding how programming concepts relate to algorithms.
unified_data.prerequisites: None. Basic computer literacy is recommended.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Learn a powerful problem-solving process (Seven Steps) for programming. Develop algorithms and understand how programming concepts relate to them. Improve reading code and problem-solving abilities.

original_data.Title: Fundamentals of Macroscopic and Microscopic Thermodynamics
original_data.Short Intro: Course 1 first explores the basics of both macroscopic and microscopic thermodynamics from a postulatory point of view. In this view, the meaning of temperature, thermodynamic pressure and chemical potential are especially clear and easy to understand. In addition , the development of the Fundamental Relation and its various transformations leads to a clear path to property relations and to the concept of ensembles needed to understand the relationship between atomic and molecular structural properties and macroscopic properties.  We then explore the relationship between atomic and molecular structure and macroscopic properties by taking a statistical point of view. Using a postulatory approach, the method for doing this is made clear. This leads to the development of the partition function which describes the distribution of molecular quantum states as a function of the independent, macroscopic thermodynamic properties.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: Fundamentals of Macroscopic and Microscopic Thermodynamics
unified_data.description: Course 1 first explores the basics of both macroscopic and microscopic thermodynamics from a postulatory point of view. In this view, the meaning of temperature, thermodynamic pressure and chemical potential are especially clear and easy to understand. In addition , the development of the Fundamental Relation and its various transformations leads to a clear path to property relations and to the concept of ensembles needed to understand the relationship between atomic and molecular structural properties and macroscopic properties.  We then explore the relationship between atomic and molecular structure and macroscopic properties by taking a statistical point of view. Using a postulatory approach, the method for doing this is made clear. This leads to the development of the partition function which describes the distribution of molecular quantum states as a function of the independent, macroscopic thermodynamic properties.
unified_data.prerequisites: Basic understanding of calculus and physics concepts. High school chemistry is recommended.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Understand macroscopic and microscopic thermodynamics from a postulatory viewpoint. Learn the Fundamental Relation and its transformations. Develop proficiency in using partition functions to relate molecular structure to macroscopic properties.

original_data.Title: Visual Elements of User Interface Design
original_data.Short Intro: This design-centric course examines the broad question of what an interface is and what role a designer plays in creating a user interface. Learning how to design and articulate meaning using color, type, and imagery is essential to making interfaces function clearly and seamlessly. Through a series of lectures and visual exercises, you will focus on the many individual elements and components that make up the skillset of an interface designer. By the end of this course, you will be able to describe the key formal elements of clear, consistent, and intuitive UI design, and apply your learned skills to the design of a static screen-based interface.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Vietnamese, German, Russian, English, Spanish
original_data.Skills: User Interface Design (UI Design),User Experience (UX),Graphic Design,

unified_data.title: Visual Elements of User Interface Design

By the end of this course, you will be able to describe the key formal elements of clear, consistent, and intuitive UI design, and apply your learned skills to the design of a static screen-based interface.
unified_data.prerequisites: Basic computer skills and a willingness to learn design principles. No prior design experience is required.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Describe UI design principles, apply design elements like color and typography, and design a static screen-based interface. Understand the role of a UI designer and create clear, consistent, and intuitive interfaces.

original_data.Title: Professional Selling: Step 2 - Prepare Like a High-Performer
original_data.Short Intro: Foundational Skills and Knowledge Required of High Performing Salespeople. This course takes the mystery out of prospecting and establishing needs. Learners will gain a clear understanding of the prospecting process and the fundamental skills required to build lasting, long-term, trusting relationships with customers. Participants in Course Two will gain skills in understanding their product's value, identifying good prospects, maximizing the sales funnel, improving conversion ratios, creating a strategic prospecting plan, understanding the WIFM, creating an effective elevator speech, overcoming call reluctance, and so much more.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: English
original_data.Skills: Utilize methods for talking with and engaging leads,Strategize to gain qualified leads and referrals,Establish needs and problems that needs solutions for a prospect,Differentiate the traits that make up a good prospect from those of a bad prospect,Track conversion ratios,

original_data.Title: Leading and Developing Top Talent
original_data.Short Intro: This course offers seasoned and up-and-coming leaders a clear, concise overview of hiring for team culture, the concepts and practices of building a productive environment for remote and hybrid teams, and leading organizational strategies, which begins with developing a strategic plan, creating SMART goals, and determining the most critical key performance indicators or metrics to manage and measure the plan’s success. Studies have shown that leading and developing talent includes creating a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging. As a result, this course provides strategies for identifying, attracting, and retaining a diverse team of employees. Finally, the course includes best practices for coaching and mentoring based on a partnership that provides support and challenging opportunities to employees.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: English
original_data.Skills: Attract and retain a diverse team of employees,Increase collaboration by implementing strategies for team performance,Understand the purpose and importance of developing a team culture,Promote effective communication for both individuals and group members,Ensure accountability to diversity and inclusion efforts for a sense of belonging,

Studies have shown that leading and developing talent includes creating a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging. skills: Attract and retain a diverse team of employees
Increase collaboration by implementing strategies for team performance
Understand the purpose and importance of developing a team culture
Promote effective communication for both individuals and group members
Ensure accountability to diversity and inclusion efforts for a sense of belonging
unified_data.prerequisites: Basic leadership experience or understanding of team dynamics is recommended. No formal prerequisites required.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Learn to build a productive environment for remote/hybrid teams. Develop strategic plans, set SMART goals, and understand key performance indicators. Strategies for attracting/retaining diverse teams and coaching/mentoring.
unified_data.price: Free to Audit. Paid Certificate Available.

original_data.Title: Writing and Editing: Revising
original_data.Short Intro: This fourth and final course in the “Good with Words: Writing and Editing” series will help you master perhaps the most important step in the writing process: revising. You’ll learn about the difference between editing and proofreading. You’ll practice “un-numbing the numbers” so that data and statistics you use are clear and compelling. And you’ll be introduced to a framework for giving and receiving feedback that helpfully systematizes what should be cut and what should be kept from each draft.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: Arabic, French, Portuguese (European), Italian, Portuguese (Brazilian), Vietnamese, German, Javanese, Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: Writing and Editing: Revising
unified_data.description: This fourth and final course in the “Good with Words: Writing and Editing” series will help you master perhaps the most important step in the writing process: revising. You’ll learn about the difference between editing and proofreading. You’ll practice “un-numbing the numbers” so that data and statistics you use are clear and compelling. And you’ll be introduced to a framework for giving and receiving feedback that helpfully systematizes what should be cut and what should be kept from each draft.
unified_data.prerequisites: Basic writing skills. Familiarity with fundamental grammar and sentence structure is recommended.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Understand the difference between editing and proofreading. Learn to make data and statistics clear and compelling. Master a framework for giving and receiving constructive feedback to improve writing.

original_data.Title: High-Impact Business Writing
original_data.Short Intro: Effective writing is a powerful tool in the business environment. Learn how to articulate your thoughts in a clear and concise manner that will allow your ideas to be better understood by your readers. Improve your business writing skill by learning to select and use appropriate formats for your audience, use the correct medium and adjust your writing style accordingly, as well as identify your objective and communicate it clearly. You'll also learn to spot, correct and avoid the most common writing pitfalls, and gain valuable experience analyzing, writing and revising a wide spectrum of business documents. From a simple email to a complete report, learn how to put good business writing to work for you.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: English

From a simple email to a complete report, learn how to put good business writing to work for you.
unified_data.prerequisites: Basic understanding of English grammar and the ability to write simple sentences.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Upon completion, you will be able to write clear, concise business documents, select appropriate formats, and avoid common writing pitfalls. You'll also gain experience in analyzing, writing, and revising various business documents.

original_data.Title: Game Design Document: Define the Art & Concepts
original_data.Short Intro: The Capstone project is a place for you to develop your game idea into a fully-fleshed proposal. A game design document is your game bible, the go-to document that defines the genre of your game, its look and feel, and the evolution of gameplay. This four-part capstone project guides you to distill and improve the foundational aspects of your game so that you may express your ideas in a clear and productive way.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: French, Portuguese (European), Russian, English, Spanish

prerequisites: Basic understanding of game design principles
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Develop a comprehensive game design document. Define the genre, look, and feel of your game. Improve foundational aspects of your game to express ideas clearly.

original_data.Title: Professional Selling: Step 1 - Think Like a High-Performer
original_data.Short Intro: Foundational Skills and Knowledge Required of High Performing Salespeople. This course takes the mystery out of sales and the sales process. Learners will gain a clear understanding of the sales process and the fundamental skills required to build lasting, long-term, trusting relationships with customers. Participants in Course One will be provided “The Road Map” to the sales process and learn how the highest performing salespeople think about sales and sales activity. Important to successfully developing strong relationships is understanding how to build trust and how salespeople move customers through their purchasing decisions.
